intro: Cacalia matsudae, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
